strings.testName: The 2025 Logic of Practice: A Resource-Mapping Diagnostic for the Digital Field
strings.quizSub: Answer each item on a 7-point scale.

items.E1: I could cover at least one month of essential living costs using savings I can access within 7 days, even if my main income stopped today, without taking on new debt or selling long-term investments.
items.E2: My monthly income allows me to budget effectively for the next six months.
items.E3: I have enough liquid savings to cover six months of essential living expenses.
items.E4: Housing costs in my area frequently prevent me from investing in my future/skills.
items.E5: I often worry about my income fluctuating unpredictably from month to month.
items.E6: I feel financially secure enough to take significant career risks.
items.E7: I can easily afford the quality of healthcare I need without financial stress.
items.E8: My debt levels are manageable and do not limit my daily life choices.
items.E9: I find it difficult to save any portion of my income for retirement.
items.E10: I have access to diverse lines of credit or capital if I needed to start a project.
items.E11: I feel stressed when thinking about my long-term financial future.
items.E12: I can afford to outsource tasks (cleaning, delivery, etc.) to save my own time.
items.E13: I regularly invest in assets (stocks, property, crypto) to build long-term wealth.
items.E14: My financial situation rarely limits my ability to travel or relocate.
items.E15: I frequently use "Buy Now Pay Later" or high-interest loans for basic needs.
items.E16: I am satisfied with my current standard of living relative to my peers.
items.E17: I can support family members financially without it impacting my own stability.
items.E18: I have a comprehensive financial plan that I review with professional advisors.
items.E19: I avoid important life decisions because I worry about the immediate cost.
items.E20: My income has grown significantly or stayed resilient over the past two years.
items.E21: I feel "trapped" in my current job solely because of my financial obligations.
items.E22: I can easily replace essential household appliances or technology if they break.
items.E23: I have multiple sources of income that protect me from a single job loss.
items.E24: I feel adequately protected against inflation and rising costs of living.
items.S1: I have many close contacts I can rely on for emergency financial help or housing.
items.S2: My social network includes people with significant professional influence or power.
items.S3: I have digital networks that provide professional opportunities I cannot find locally.
items.S4: I feel a strong sense of belonging and mutual trust within my neighborhood.
items.S5: I often interact with people from diverse socioeconomic or cultural backgrounds.
items.S6: If I lost my job today, I know several people who could help me find a new one immediately.
items.S7: I find it difficult to ask people in my network for significant favors.
items.S8: I am an active member of professional associations or exclusive digital communities.
items.S9: I generally trust the people I interact with in my daily social circles.
items.S10: I have a mentor or confidant who provides me with high-level career advice.
items.S11: My connections often introduce me to new ideas, information, or resources.
items.S12: I feel lonely or socially isolated in my professional life.
items.S13: People in my network often cooperate with me to achieve shared goals.
items.S14: I believe my reputation within my community is a major asset for me.
items.S15: I frequently participate in civic or community activities that build trust.
items.S16: I find it hard to maintain long-term professional relationships.
items.S17: My network includes experts in fields that are very different from my own.
items.S18: I feel comfortable talking to high-status individuals in my professional field.
items.S19: I am often asked to connect people within my network to one another.
items.S20: I feel my social connections have significantly improved my life chances.
items.S21: I lack contacts who can provide me with specialized or technical knowledge.
items.S22: I can easily mobilize a group of people to support a cause I care about.
items.S23: I belong to groups that provide me with a distinct sense of identity and pride.
items.S24: My social network allows me to bypass formal barriers to get things done.
items.C1: I am confident in reading, writing, and comprehending complex data sets to make decisions.
items.C2: I hold verified certifications or credentials that are highly recognized in my field.
items.C3: I have a collection of digital learning resources (courses, e-books) I use for self-improvement.
items.C4: I feel comfortable and at home in high-status professional or academic environments.
items.C5: I am proficient in using AI tools to enhance my productivity or creativity.
items.C6: I possess technical skills that are in high demand in the current labor market.
items.C7: I find it difficult to understand technical discussions or modern digital jargon.
items.C8: I have been exposed to diverse cultural ideas through travel or intentional learning.
items.C9: I can adapt my communication style (tone, language) for different cultural audiences.
items.C10: I enjoy exploring complex intellectual topics that are outside my immediate expertise.
items.C11: I feel my educational background has given me a major advantage in life.
items.C12: I struggle to keep up with rapid changes in technology.
items.C13: I am comfortable writing or speaking in a style that is seen as highly educated.
items.C14: I frequently engage in hobbies that require high levels of skill or specialized knowledge.
items.C15: I am usually the person people turn to for advice on how to use new tools or software.
items.C16: I feel out of place when discussing high-culture topics like art or philosophy.
items.C17: I have a broad vocabulary that allows me to express complex ideas clearly.
items.C18: I am confident in my ability to teach myself any new skill using online resources.
items.C19: I feel that I have good taste in music, art, or design that others respect.
items.C20: I lack the formal qualifications needed to reach the next level of my career.
items.C21: I can critically evaluate whether a digital news source or piece of media is reliable.
items.C22: I frequently share knowledge or mentor others in my areas of expertise.
items.C23: I have access to the latest hardware and high-speed internet needed for my work.
items.C24: I feel my worldview is global and not limited by my local upbringing.
items.Y1: Others frequently seek my input or defer to my judgment in professional settings.
items.Y2: I possess verified status or visible badges of expertise on professional or social platforms.
items.Y3: My professional contributions regularly garner significant visibility and engagement from peers.
items.Y4: I am regarded as an expert or visionary in my specific area of work.
items.Y5: I have received prestigious awards, honors, or public recognition for my achievements.
items.Y6: People generally treat me with a high level of respect when I introduce myself.
items.Y7: I feel my accomplishments are often overlooked or under-credited.
items.Y8: I am frequently invited to speak at events or participate in high-level meetings.
items.Y9: I hold a title or role that commands automatic legitimacy in the eyes of others.
items.Y10: I believe my personal brand or reputation is a major driver of my success.
items.Y11: Others often mention my previous successes when they introduce me to new people.
items.Y12: I find it hard to get people to take my ideas seriously.
items.Y13: My opinions are highly valued in my social and professional communities.
items.Y14: I am often asked to lead or moderate groups because of my perceived authority.
items.Y15: I feel like a role model to others in my field or community.
items.Y16: I rarely receive the recognition I feel I deserve for my hard work.
items.Y17: My presence in a room or digital space is immediately noticed by others.
items.Y18: I am confident that my reputation would protect me during a crisis or scandal.
items.Y19: People often follow or subscribe to my updates to see what I am doing.
items.Y20: I feel insignificant or overlooked in most professional settings.
items.Y21: I have been cited or quoted by others as a source of authority.
items.Y22: I am satisfied with the level of influence I have over decisions in my field.
items.Y23: I believe I could achieve a higher social status if I chose to pursue it.
items.Y24: I feel proud of the professional legacy or reputation I have built.
